intro: Pyrenacantha rostrata, commonly known as the rostrated pyrenacantha, is a shrub native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its evergreen leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant produces small, red berries that are an important food source for local wildlife. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or coastal habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
